channel.title: About on Aaron Lee
channel.description: Recent content in About on Aaron Lee

item.title: About
item.description:
Hello, my name is Aaron; I am a student at the University of Warwick. I study a combination of computer and biomedical systems engineering, and molecular and systems biology.

My main interests lie in synthetic/engineering biology, in the application of computational and engineering methods to synthetic genetic circuitry.

Synthetic biology is a field I have been passionate about since very early on in my lifeâ€”I was first exposed to genetic engineering in year 8 (2018), with the release of Justin Atkin’s presentation of his DIY lactose intolerance gene therapy, and subsequent spider silk-producing yeast. This encouraged me to engage in various DIY biologist and engineering communities, and inspired both my A-level choices (Maths, CompSci, Biology, Chemistry) and choice of degree.
